title: Single-stage turn-over muscular hinge flap with Burow's full-thickness skin graft to repair oral commissure defect.

tldr.text: A 73-year-old Caucasian man presented with a recurrent squamous cell carcinoma of the right oral commissure that had been present for at least 4 years and was excised using Mohs micrographic surgery, requiring two stages to achieve a tumor-free plane.

references.title: An interesting observation in lip reconstruction.
Trilobed Skin Flap on the Face: For Reconstruction of Full‐Thickness or Commissural Defects
A new plastic operation for the relief of deformity due to double harelip.
